job_title: Retired in Fort Worth, TX
pros: CCA is an award-winning nonprofit that is innovative and really cares. It's a job you can "give back" to your community. Incredible benefits. Opportunities to progress.
cons: Child care is such a hard industry but the promise of quality early education is amazing. CCA can continue to listen to its employees - but it does and works to improve and change. Public funding have restrictions so they can't give bonuses and such.

job_title: Early Childhood Educator in Fort Worth, TX
pros: Making a difference in the children’s lives that I teach and touch by building strong relationships with them and their parents that last for years to come.
cons: Sometimes it’s hard to take off when you need too if someone else or to many others already requested that day even in an emergency!!! Not always enough time at work for planning so it has to be done at home.

job_title: Nutrition Specialist in Fort Worth, TX

job_title: Director in Fort Worth, TX
pros: CCA is a company that cares for it's program participants and it's staff. CCA provides competitive salaries with great benefits to include a generous PTO schedule that allows for work-life balance.
cons: Like all companies, a few staff are not willing to do their part. But, it most cases the company provides coaching for those staff.

job_title: Teaching Assistant in Mansfield, TX
pros: The kids are always characters and depending on what facility you're at, it can be a comfortable workplace.
cons:
Everything else.

-Pay is ridiculously low. In-N-Out burger makes more money.
-Management mostly consists of devil women who have no consideration for their employees and gossip like 14 year olds.
-Trainings are completely meaningless and require travel for information that could be sent to you in an email
-Staff in general has a petty gossip issue
-Food is supposed to be healthy for the kids, but consists of the same food being rotated on a 2 week cycle, that comes out of bulk cans of preservatives and freezer bags, and tons of salt and butter. (I gained 3 consistent pounds working there, even trying to avoid the meals, which you can't because it's part of the curriculum)
-Job culture is heeeeaaavily Christian. I'm personally not Christian, and a lot of the parents aren't either. To me, embedding that into the classroom environment seems wrong and uncalled for. It's not a Christian based company (it doesn't state that anywhere), I don't think that should be so heavily influenced around the kids. They'll make that choice when they're older and work with that with their parents.

job_title: Clerk in Fort Worth, TX
pros: Generous PTO, long term, dedicated employees at the centers.
cons: Company steuggles in communication from the top down. Once you apply for a job, you will need to physically go up to the office to see if they have even received your application. It will sit for weeks. They hired new executives in HR and one would expect for improvements in HR and company culture to start improving, but haven't seen any initiatives trickle out of that office. The number of chiefs and directors have tripled in the past year, yet they are "out of funding" for lower employees who have put in 20 plus years with CCA. Each department is divided and points and at the other one and says it's not my job. I don't think executive management can tell you the name of one child out of the thousands that participate in the program. Practice your mission from the top and maybe it can change.

job_title: Lead Teacher in Fort Worth, TX
pros: Great Benefits,Friendly CO - Workers, Very warm facility, Great food. Smart, creative teachers, very clean environment. Two play grounds to separates, toddlers and infants  from children 3 years and up.
cons: Assistant Management members take much down time. Generally short handed. Art supplies are ok but could be better as in better quality.

review_title: Pride in working for a place that makes a "Lifetime of Difference"
job_title: Director in Fort Worth, TX
pros:
1. CCA is a place where every child has an opportunity for an excellent early childhood education through its corps of teachers and the management team that support them.
2. CCA supports its staff with paid family leave (six weeks) for new parents or parents who are adopting. 
3. CCA's certified teachers are now being paid same as School District teachers!!!
cons: Takes a long time to get processed which is a problem with background checks.

job_title: Head Start Teacher in Fort Worth, TX
pros: I love being effective in children's lives.  I love challenges.  I believe impossible is impossible because anything you apply yourself to it will make a difference.
cons: I feel the teachers should be more concerned about the children's future.

review_title: It was okay until I received a job at ISD.
job_title: Teacher in Fort Worth, TX
pros: The company has great benefits and it always feels great to help children who are at risk.  Working with other great people make the job even better.
cons: The bad side of the company is you aren't paid enough for all the work that has to be done and you work during the summer unlike the independent school districts.

job_title: Relative Child Care Provider in Arlington, TX
pros: I have the chance to help mold and nurture my wonderful nephews and nieces for the past seven years.
cons: Downside side I think would be I have missed a lot of whats going on in the work force. Now that I am going back into to workforce it feels like I am starting all over again.
